Applied Media Aesthetics: Introduction to Cinematography, Audio-Capture, and Editing

This module explores the fundamental principles of media aesthetics through a combination of theoretical analysis and hands-on production. Students will examine how visual and auditory elements - such as light, colour, space, motion, and sound - shape meaning and perception through their capture and composition in film and media.The growing influence of artificial intelligence (AI) in creative media production will be explored and students will critically assess how AI tools in cinematography, sound design, editing, and visual effects are reshaping media aesthetics.

Learning Objectives for this module:

+  Demonstrate the ability to analyse and apply media aesthetics principles to practical media production projects and Critically reflect on how AI and algorithmic tools are influencing aesthetics.

+  Demonstrate technical proficiency in fundamental media production techniques.

+  Exhibit problem-solving and collaboration and critical thinking skills in the media production practice.

+  Be able to reflect on, and evaluate their own work and provide constructive feedback on peers’ projects
